I always had a very nice restaurant that was *my* restaurant wherever I’ve lived. 99.9% dined there alone—.1% was if grownup kid joined me. 
I enjoy the quiet time, and neither read nor scroll on phone as a solo diner.
Forced community tables are not my thing; others seem to like them.

talk.utter: Aside: I loved the movie The Cook, The Thief, His Wife, and Her Lover. The thing that drew me in at first was Her Lover sitting in this upscale establishment night after night eating alone and reading a book. That seemed like heaven.

talk.author: did:plc:z3atoy4mdsbi3kwlaskp46jn
talk.utter: That was a wonderful movie!! There was a bar I used to go to where I’d read, but their walls were covered in authors, they had the strangest playlist I’ve ever heard, and got no cellphone reception. It kinda begged for a good book!
